title: *: bump version to 0.8.0
body: - [x] Wait for https://github.com/tikv/grpc-rs/pull/507

title: grpc-sys: update bindgen to 0.57
body:
The purpose is to make tikv build natively on apple silicon.

Although bindgen 0.56 works on apple silicon, I hope to update bindgen to the latest version to keep it consistent with https://github.com/tikv/rust-rocksdb/pull/605.

title: *: bump 0.7.1
body: Signed-off-by: Xintao <hunterlxt@live.com>

title: Add user-defined checker for server side
body:
Users can provide custom checker to decide if the grpc call should be aborted in advance or be continued. For operations like check common name, a lot of redundant code can be avoided.

## How to implement?
Execute the custom closure provided by the user at the `execute` function from `src/call/server.rs`. If the user declares that the grpc call has been aborted, then skip the subsequent grpc handler.

Signed-off-by: Xintao <hunterlxt@live.com>

title: Allow CXX environment variable to override g++ for musl build
body:
The `musl-gcc` cross compiler doesn't come with a corresponding
`musl-g++`, so #195 hard-coded the C++ compiler to `g++` when
building for musl. However, this results in building native binaries using
the native compiler, rather than an available musl toolchain (e.g.,
`x86_64-linux-musl-g++`).

This PR modifies the build script to allow the `CXX` environment
variable to override `g++`, even when building for musl.

cc: @csssuf @Hoverbear from #195

title: Add a way to not use bindgen
body:
Fix #489

Add the `use-bindgen` feature which is activated by default.

If disabled, then the previously generated bindings will be used instead of generating new ones. It will fail compilation if this feature is disabled for the non supported targets.

If enabled, the behaviour is the same as before.

title: grpc-sys: Upgrade bindgen to the latest version
body: As requested in https://github.com/tikv/grpc-rs/pull/452#issuecomment-729693080.

title: channel: fix incorrect parameter doc
body: Close #491.

title: *: update grpc c core to 1.33.1
body: This PR updates grpc c core to 1.33.1. Upstream adds a new re2 module which makes the size of the crate too large. I optimize it by introducing a new `boringssl-src` crate. It can slow the compilation a little bit as it need to download extra package but the size of the library becomes 5.4MB now.

title: Update parking_lot to version 0.11
body:
Thanks for maintaining this crate. Some additional context for this change:

We're considering grpc-rs for use in the Android open source project[1]. For Android, it's important that we limit the number of crate versions that are used because that reduces both memory and disk usage, both of critical importance on resource-constrained Android devices. Generally we try to achieve that by only depending on the latest version of each crate that we directly or indirectly use. This change moves us to the most recent version of parking_lot, which also results in updating to the most recent version of a couple of its dependencies.

[1]: https://android-review.googlesource.com/c/platform/external/rust/crates/grpcio/+/1460423

title: Add methods for channels from file descriptors
body:
Expose methods to allow creating server and client channels from existing

title: *: use grpc_slice to avoid copy
body:
Use grpc_slice to reduce memory copy. If the messages are small,
this should reduce allocations.

title: compiler: do not emit rustfmt_skip inner attr, since it is unstable
body:
Codegen emitted an inner `cfg_attr` attribute, which caused problems with stable Rust (according to https://github.com/tikv/raft-rs/issues/390#issuecomment-670342443). This PR removes that line. The user can always add it as an outer attribute if they want to skip formatting.

cc https://github.com/tikv/raft-rs/issues/390

PTAL @BusyJay @overvenus

title: Pick Add blocking callback to EnvBuilder (#474)
body: Signed-off-by: Xintao <hunterlxt@live.com>

title: Add blocking callback to EnvBuilder
body:
This allows users to manipulate the thread pool created by gRPC. They can add some custom code like print logs for newly created threads and reclaim some resources or record when exiting the thread.

Note: It is recommended to PR pick to 0.5.x

Signed-off-by: Xintao <hunterlxt@live.com>

title: Make clippy happy
body: Signed-off-by: Xintao <hunterlxt@live.com>

title: Enhance sinks to make them batchable
body:
close #415 

Optimize `send_all` using sink in grpc-rs. By buffering the message to be sent to determine whether there is still message in the stream, and add the `buffer_hint` flag to indicate follow-up messages.

After a simple test, this does improve the QPS by 50% when you use `send_all` method.

```
Before
======== test_client_stream_send_split
QPS: 13626.411713542033
======== test_client_stream_send_all
QPS: 13458.8795676736
======== test_server_stream_send_all
QPS: 21513.004479575207

After
======== test_client_stream_send_split
QPS: 13632.78241828707
======== test_client_stream_send_all
QPS: 20634.743684214573
======== test_server_stream_send_all
QPS: 21282.527286920154

Tcpdump capture file size (only send_all test)
Before：22M
After：2.6M
```

Related test code: https://github.com/hunterlxt/grpc-rs/blob/xt/bench-sink-over-master/tests-and-examples/examples/hello_world/client.rs

Additional benchmark with standard grpc driver (before vs after)
```
rust_protobuf_async_streaming_from_client_100msg_unconstrained
QPS: 12058.0
QPS: 41914.1
rust_protobuf_async_streaming_ping_pong
QPS: 18315.0
QPS: 20409.9
rust_protobuf_async_streaming_qps_unconstrained
QPS: 589875.8
QPS: 584359.6
```

title: Replace Spinlock with parking_lot::Mutex
body:
After testing, the performance of parking_lot is better than `Spinlock` or `std::sync::Mutex`

Note: Only replace the lock in grpcio, the lock in the example remains the original usage

Signed-off-by: Xintao <hunterlxt@live.com>

title: Switch to github action
body: Travis has wasted a lot of our time, maybe we should try something new.

title: Enable ALPN as default
body:
NPN, the Next Protocol Negotiation extension, is specified by [a draft expired 6 years ago](https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-agl-tls-nextprotoneg-04) and has been replaced by ALPN. So I suggest that we should support its successor ALPN to ensure successful connection to the servers with ALPN only.

Signed-off-by: TXXT <hunterlxt@live.com>

It's supported by c core, we just need to allow it as parameter.

Load balancing is supported in the grpc c core, but load report is not
implemented yet. It's hard to implement load report without census API.

Related grpc/grpc#22418.

title: Improve `Debug` impl of `RpcStatusCode`
body:
Helps #432 

This is an complementary approach to #433 for improving the `Display` impl for `grpcio::Error`, which requires less code. It has the additional effect of improving the `RpcStatusCode` and `RpcStatus` debug displays.

Note that this doesn't make #433 unnecessary: #433 still improves the `Display` implementation for `grpcio::Error` compared to this.

Once this is merged though, #433 can be expressed in an easier way.

title: Security: Support cert reload
body:
* Support for using user-supplied fetcher to dynamically provide certificates for servers. The fetcher will be called during initialization and addition for handshakers.

* Move certificates from integration tests code into files to reduce compilation time.

title: Better Display impl for grpcio::Error
body:
Resolves #432

**What it does:**
 - Impl Display for RpcStatus and RpcStatusCode
 - Update Display impl for grpcio::Error

Signed-off-by: Elrendio <oscar.walter@ens.fr>

title: Add `Eq` to `RpcStatusCode` to allow use in pattern matching
body:
Current implementation respects the rules of [`Eq`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/cmp/trait.Eq.html).

Current missing derive prevents use in pattern matching:
```
to use a constant of type `grpcio::call::RpcStatusCode` in a pattern, `grpcio::call::RpcStatusCode` must be annotated with `#[derive(PartialEq, Eq)]`
```

body:
follow #356 this pr support pre generated binding for aarch64, so we can get rid of depending on newer version of clang.

title: Update dependencies of grpcio-compiler
body: Signed-off-by: koushiro <koushiro.cqx@gmail.com>

title: *: use libz-sys instead of bundled one
body:
When using the built-in cmake to build zlib, it changes the source tree
as madler/zlib#162 describes. This leads to the failure during
[generating the docs][1]. So let's switch to libz-sys instead, which
uses its own custom script to build zlib, and leave source tree as it
is. Switching to libz-sys can also reduce the package size as we can
ignore more sub modules. It should improve compile time if libz-sys is
also a dependency of other crates.

The only shortcoming is that libz-sys may not be compatible with
grpcio, but I believe the chance is quite small given it's such a small
library. And giving it's such a small library, the benifits like compile
time or package size described above may be too small to be observed.

[1]: https://docs.rs/crate/grpcio/0.5.0-alpha.5/builds/196235.
